## News Review for evana

# Evana News Review

## Executive Summary

FOXO Technologies subsidiary Myrtle Recovery Centers is developing a mobile application called Evana designed to connect post-discharge patients with care professionals for ongoing monitoring and after-care support, according to the company's year-end shareholder review. The application, currently in development with software developers, aims to improve patient care satisfaction following discharge, establish alumni support systems, and increase community awareness of Myrtle Recovery Centers' capabilities in the healthcare recovery sector.

## Key Developments

**Product Development**
- Launch of Evana mobile application development project by Myrtle Recovery Centers, a FOXO Technologies subsidiary
- Application designed to connect post-discharge patients with care professionals for monitoring and meeting patient after-care needs
- Software developers engaged to build the mobile platform specifically for Myrtle Recovery Centers' post-discharge patient population
- Expected benefits include improved patient care satisfaction, development of alumni support systems, and increased community awareness of Myrtle's services

*Source: [FOXO Technologies CEO Year-End Review](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/12/15/3205393/0/en/FOXO-TECHNOLOGIES-INC-CEO-SEAMUS-LAGAN-PROVIDES-YEAR-END-REVIEW-TO-SHAREHOLDERS.html)*

## Market Context

The Evana mobile application represents an entry into the healthcare technology sector focused on post-discharge patient care and recovery services. This development positions the solution within the growing digital health market, specifically targeting the gap in patient care continuity after discharge from recovery centers. The application addresses the healthcare industry's increasing focus on patient engagement and outcomes tracking beyond initial treatment periods.

## Strategic Implications

The development of Evana indicates FOXO Technologies' expansion into healthcare technology solutions through its Myrtle Recovery Centers subsidiary. By creating a dedicated mobile platform for post-discharge patient care, the company is positioning itself to capture value in the patient retention and care continuity market. The focus on alumni support systems suggests a strategy to build long-term patient relationships and community engagement, potentially creating recurring revenue opportunities and strengthening Myrtle Recovery Centers' market position in the competitive healthcare recovery sector.
